intro: Perotis humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's perotis, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to yellow.
